div.div: Procreate End-User Guide
Chapter . Introduction
What is Procreate?
In this documentation you will leran about Procreate and its more advanced features.
Chapter . Gradients
What are gradients?
In this section you will learn about gradients and when to use them.
How to create a gradient
In this section you will learn how to create basic gradients in Procreate.
Chapter . Layers
What are layers?
In this topic you will learn what layers are and when to use them.
How to change the layer blend mode

Layer blend modes change the way
layers react with each other. These are like sunglasses for your layers that can become x-ray specs and a whole lot more.
How to add layer masks
In this section you will learn about layer masks and how to integrate them in your design.
Chapter . Liquify
What is liquify?
The Liquify filter lets you push, pull, rotate, reflect and bloat any area of an image.
How to use the Liquify Tool
The Liqufy Tool provides and easy to use interface for Liquify.
Chapter . Animation
How to create a basic animation
Procreate offers a simple but very useful interface aimed at animators.
Chapter . References
List of supported file types for import and export
Here you will find all supported files formats for import and export.
Shortcuts and gestures
Here is a lift of some shortcuts and gestures you might find useful.

div.domains: (map mapgroup-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic delay-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (map ditavalref-d) (map glossref-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d)

div.p: In this documentation you will leran about Procreate and its more advanced features.

Procreate is a raster graphics editor app for digital painting developed and published by Savage Interactive for iOS and iPadOS. The aim of Procreate is to recreate the natural feel of physical drawing, while providing all the advantages of a digital platform.
This End-User guide is inteded for people that are already familiar with the basic Procreate interface. If you are a complete newbie to Procreate, please check out our Procreate Quick Start Guide.

div.domains: (map mapgroup-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic delay-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (map ditavalref-d) (map glossref-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d)

div.p: In this section you will learn about gradients and when to use them.

In computer graphics, a color gradient specifies a range of position-dependent colors, usually used to fill a region. The colors produced by a gradient vary continuously with position, producing smooth color transitions.
Simply said a color gradient is a set of colors arranged in a linear order.
In this section you will learn how to create basic gradients in Procreate.

section.p: In order to create a gradient you first need to have purchased Procreate and have a loaded project.
Gradients can be added to any project to create visual interest and help move users through a design. The gradients are a highly useful and engaging design tool.

li.span: Tap the Adjustments iconon the left side of the top toolbar.
Tap on Gradient Map
Choose a gradient palette from the Gradient Library toolbar that has appeared.
Use your fimger to slide the palette color in order to alter the gradient.

section.p: The gradient palette you have created will appear on the layer you are currently working on.

div.section: Gradients make a perfect background for any design. They are also very trendy right now!

div.domains: (map mapgroup-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic delay-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (map ditavalref-d) (map glossref-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d)

div.p: In this topic you will learn what layers are and when to use them.

Layers are an essential digital feature of image editing software. They are like stacked sheets of transparent paper. Using layers to overlap each other gives depth to a design. Layers are used in digital image editing to separate different elements of an image.

h2.span: How to change the layer blend mode

div.p: Layer blend modes change the way layers react with each other. These are like sunglasses for your layers that can become x-ray specs and a whole lot more.

section.p: Before you begin you need an open project in Procreate with at least 1 added layer.
You can use blending modes whenever you need to change how the colors of a whole level interact.

li.span: Click on the Layers icon
Select the layer you want to apply the blend mode to.
Click on the "N" symbol on the right side of the layer.
Choose a new blend mode of choice from the drop down menu that has shown up. The default is Normal.

section.p: You have now changed the blend mode and the symbol on the right side of the layers panel will no longer be "N".
If you choose a layer mode like "Darken" for example, you will be anything that is darker than white is going to have some darkening effect on the pixels below it.

div.p: In this section you will learn about layer masks and how to integrate them in your design.

section.p: Before you begin you need an open project in Procreate with at least 1 added layer.

Layer masks allow you to selectively modify the opacity (transparency) of the layer they belong to. They are especially useful when you need to selectively modify the opacity of different areas across a single layer.

li.span: Click on the Layers icon
Swipe right-to-left on your layer of choice to open the menu.
Tap on Mask.

section.p: Your layer mask will appear above the selected layer.
Erasing or painting in black hides parts of the parent layer, and painting in white reveals parts. Varying shades of gray alter the content with corresponding levels of opacity.

div.domains: (map mapgroup-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic delay-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (map ditavalref-d) (map glossref-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d)

div.p: The Liquify filter lets you push, pull, rotate, reflect and bloat any area of an image.
The distortions you create can be subtle or drastic, which makes the Liquify command a powerful tool for retouching images as well as creating artistic effects.

h2.span: How to use the Liquify Tool

div.p: The Liqufy Tool provides and easy to use interface for Liquify.

section.p: Before you begin you need an open project in Procreate with some content on it.
With this tool you can push, pull, rotate, reflect and bloat any area of an image.

li.span: Tap the Adjustments iconon the left side of the top toolbar.
Tap on Liquify.
From the bottom toolbox that has appeared, choose a liquify option and your preffered brush settings.
Start "painting" the changes on.

section.p: You should see the distortion of your choice appear over your painting.

div.section: All those before and after images we see of celebrities are a courtesy of the The Liquify Tool.

div.domains: (map mapgroup-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic delay-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (map ditavalref-d) (map glossref-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d)

h2.span: How to create a basic animation

div.p: Procreate offers a simple but very useful interface aimed at animators.

section.p: Before you begin you need an open project in Procreate with some content on it.
Animation Assist offers the ability to edit and manage both individual frames and the animation as a whole.

li.span: Tap the Actions icon.
Tap on Canvas.
Toggle the Animation Assist on.
Select a frame you want to work on from the Animation Panel that has shown up at the bottom of the screen.
Tap Add Frame to add new frames to your animation.
Tap Play to preview your animation sequence.
Export your animation as a GIF, PNG or MP4.

section.p: You must have a simple sequence animation ready.
